question.text: A beam of electromagnetic radiation of intensity <math> <mrow> <mn>6.4</mn><mo>×</mo><mrow><mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn></mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow> </msup> <mtext>W</mtext></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>cm</mtext></mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow></mrow> </mrow> </math> is comprised of wavelength, <math><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi>λ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>310</mn><mi></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> . It falls normally on a metal (work function <math><mi>φ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>e</mi><mi>V</mi></math> ) of surface area of <math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></math> . If one in <math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></math> photons ejects an election, total number of electrons ejected in <math><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> is <math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></math> . <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1240</mn><mi></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>,</mo><mi></mi><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mi>J</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi></mi></math> then <math><mi>x</mi></math> is ___________

solution.text:
Energy of photon. E=1240310 nm=4eV>2eV (So photoelectric effect will take place)
=4×1.6×10-19=6.4×10-19joule
Number of photons falling per second
=6.4×10-5×16.4×10-19=1014
Number of photoelectron emitted per second
=1014103=1011
